text: - My name is Christian Bermudez,
I am a software development engineer
here on the AWS CloudTrail team.
I've been here for two years,
I initially started as an intern
and I made a way to full-time employee.
Like any other college student,

I was looking for anything
I can get experience in,

and Amazon was obviously one
of the big tech companies.
So, I applied, I got in,

and what hooked me was the
sheer scale of our systems
and the amount of customers
that we can impact around the world.
What surprised me here was that everyone

was just a normal person,
very relaxed, very smart,
and there was a great team atmosphere.

To prepare yourself
for an internship here,
I'd say, keep an open mind.
You're gonna meet a lot of new people,
very diverse perspectives on life
as a whole and engineering.

You're gonna learn a lot,
so just keep an open mind.
Amazon's culture is very inclusive,

we have a lot of affinity
groups that you can be a part of

by association or just
by becoming an ally.
We also have a lot of programs

where you can volunteer
your time in the community.
What kept me here was the people,
I felt very included on my team.

I grew to have great friendships
with the people I work with
inside and outside the office.
(bright music)
